datafield.subfield: Unrestricted in reading room, but coach user: tight binding and fragile corroded inks, open only to 90°, use book supports; available for classroom use in exhibit case only.
Computistical and astrological diagrams in roundels with explanatory text, designed in part to calculate dates for movable feasts and Novara local feasts.

In a dated colophon the author names Gianbatista Canello di Piacenza, NiccoloÌò Tartaglia (d. 1557) of Brescia, and others as his sources. Folios 68v-72r, 73v, and 77r are partially erased and palimpsested.

MS 3327, Container 60: Early shelfmarks or booksellers' markings on pastedowns include no. 56 F. 4304 and 948 * 25; described by Johan Gröf in Leipzig, 1921; round bookplate of Walter Emile van Wijk on inside front cover. Binding (Italy 16th c?): Full brown tanned goatskin over paper boards. Pulled-over caps, tight back over sewing supports, cut-solid edges gilded, gauffered. Gold-tooled frame and motifs, blind-tooled concentric frames, front and back covers; blind tooling and gold tooling on spine; no title. Evidence of four mixed color (blue/pink?) paired ties, centered head and tail, plus two at fore edges. Sewn endbands on alum-tawed thongs, (white thread), back bead. Sewn on three alum-tawed thongs laced on boards; paper manuscript waste spine lining with extensions. Endleaf components: front two tipped folds off-white handmade laid paper (same as text?), making pastedown, three free endleaves; back tipped fold off-white handmade laid paper different from text block, making pastedown, free endleaf, and text blank.
Medieval and Early Modern Manuscripts Collection.
